page.title: 02FARMING AROUND NENTHEAD
page.content: The farmland around Nenthead is best suited to sheep.In our block there are about 1700 breeding ewes,300 shearlings and 2,200 lambs and other sheep.Most farmers keep Swaledale ewes as they are very tough and can stand the harsh winters here.The swaledales make good mothers.Also they produce Mule<grey-faced>lambs when crossed with Blue-faced Leicesters and will either be sold as stores<to be fattened>or the female lambs will be sold as breeding ewes to lowland farmers. There are no dairy cows,but there are 400 sucklercows,bullocks and calves in our block. There is a lot of rough pasture in our block.Meadows are used to produce hay to feed the animals in winter. Only one farmer keeps 40 pigs<sows> and another keeps 2000 hens.
